resources.string:
Let's say your username is johndoe. You can now use *@johndoe.addy.io (or .me) as your email. Where * denotes any valid local part for an email address.

If you would like to remain anonymous choose a username that is not linked to your real name or identify and that you haven't used anywhere else.

You can also create aliases at shared domains if you are concerned about others linking alias ownership to you.

Either on the fly or generated beforehand. Next time you are signing up to a website or newsletter, simply make up a new alias and enter that instead of your real email address.

For example, if you are on vuejs.org and you want to sign up to their newsletter you could simply enter vuejs@johndoe.addy.io (or .me). 

We'll automatically create the alias in your dashboard as soon as it receives its first email. You can reply to emails and send from aliases anonymously too!

Let's say a spammer gets hold of one of your aliases and starts sending unsolicited email to it. You can simply toggle a switch in your dashboard and deactivate that alias.

Our system will then silently discard any further emails and you won't be forwarded anything else for that alias.

You can also delete the alias. Then our system will reject any emails and respond with an error.
Sounds like a service you’d use? If so, why not sign up.
Your API can be obtained at the settings page at app.addy.io (or your own hosted instance)
Other aliases e.g. alias@%s.addy.io or .me can also be created automatically when they receive their first email
This is a not a valid domain

What\'s new in AnonAddy for Android 5.0.1

Fixed/Improved

- Fixed the limit count for bandwidth and usernames on self-hosted instances
 

What\'s new in AnonAddy for Android for Wearables 1.3.3

Fixed/Improved

- Performance improvements and other things to make the app even smoother

The version of this addy.io instance is lower than the minimum required version to use this app. You can ignore this message and just use the app, but there is a good chance that some functions will not work.
Will Browning (addy.io)\nStjin (Android app backend)\nJPH (Android app designer)

Forgetting an alias will disassociate it from your account.\n\nNote: If this alias uses a shared domain then it can never be restored or used again so make sure you are certain. If it is a standard alias then it can be created again since it will be as if it never existed.

Enter the email addresses (comma separated) of the recipients you’d like to send an email to from an alias.

Aliases you enter that do not exist will be created automatically.

The mail app on your device opens with the correct to addresses entered. Note that you must send this email from one of your verified recipients email address.

Leaving the alias field empty allows you to send emails from your own email address (not an alias).
Check out app-exclusive features and integrations

Create aliases on the go and send emails from an alias by highlighting an email address or tapping a mailto hyperlink.\n\nHighlight an email address that doesn\'t exist with your domain name and tap the addy.io app icon to create this alias.
It may take a few minutes for the change to take effect

Keep track of emails being forwarded through a specific alias. Open the management page of an alias and enable "Watch alias" to be notified of a new forwarded message.

Use the "Background service interval" option in the app settings to determine how often to check for new forwarded messages.

You can watch a maximum of 25 aliases.

For an overview of all failed deliveries, go back to main section and tap on the failed deliveries button at the top. (mail with exclamation mark)\n\nUse the \"Background service interval\" option in the app settings to determine how often to check for failed deliveries.
Open an overview of recent failed deliveries
Receive a notification if an email sent from an alias cannot be delivered
Please note that it may take a little longer for updates to be visible in F-Droid

Open the addy.io app instead of the website for easy access and quick actions such as deactivating your alias via the link in the email banner.

Since this feature is not managed by the addy.io app but by Android itself, manual action is required to link the URL to the app. On many devices this is done automatically, but on devices with Android 12 or higher it is necessary to add this URL manually. The action is easy but cannot be automated.

Due to limitations added in Android 12, it is only possible to use this integration on the hosted instance found at app.addy.io or app.anonaddy.com.
Click on \"open by default\" and set app links to \"Open in this app\"
Click on \"open by default\" and set app links to \"Don\'t open in this app\"
Enable supported links, click on \"Add link\" and tick the checkbox in front of the URL

With addy.io app backups you can easily export and import the configuration of the app to another device. These backups include the API key and aliases that are on the watch list, but also other app settings.\n\nTo restore backups, reset the addy.io app and choose \"restore from backup\" in the setup.
Set the encryption key for backup encryption. The default password when not set is \"anonaddy\"
Set the location for backups to be stored
Periodically make backups in the background every other day. Backups are stored for 30 days and will be automatically deleted after this period
Unable to restore backup, make sure the password is correct and you have selected a valid file
Backup failed, check the backup logs for more information

Enter the backup password with which backups are encrypted.
Backups contain sensitive information so a strong password is recommended.

The backup cannot be recovered without this password

Enter the backup password with which backups are encrypted.
Backups contain sensitive information so a deleting the backup file after restoring the backup is recommended.

The backup cannot be recovered without this password
Backup location not accessible, tap here to set a new location
Receive a notification when periodic addy.io app backups fail
Unable to make periodic backup of app configuration. Tap here to view the backup log
No logs, make sure to enable storing logs in the app settings
%1$d file(s) deleted because they were older than %2$d days

The app data can no longer be read. You may have recovered the app data from another device which is not supported because the addy.io app encrypts all the app data with a device specific key. Please use the built-in addy.io app backup feature in the app settings next time. The app will be reset in 15 seconds…

With the addy.io app on your wearable device you have quick insight into your alias statistics, you can quickly create aliases and you have access to a beautiful watchface

Notification permissions are required to fully use the app. Tap here to allow the addy.io app to send notifications. You retain control over which notification the app can send.

Toggle this option to determine whether this recipient is allowed to reply and send from your aliases. When set to off this recipient will not be able to reply or send from your aliases and you will be notified when an attempt is made

Use inline (PGP/Inline) instead of PGP/MIME encryption for forwarded messages. Please Note: This will ONLY encrypt and forward the plain text content!
Enabling this setting will hide and encrypt the email subject using protected headers. Many mail clients are able to automatically decrypt and display the subject once the email arrives.
You need to disable inline encryption before you can enable protected headers (hide subject)
You need to disable protected headers (hide subject) before you can enable inline encryption
Your API key will expire in %s. It is recommended to update your API key to prevent the app from resetting. Do you want to change the API token now?
Your subscription will expire in %s. Renew your subscription to keep using pro features.
Receive a notification 5 days before your API key expires to prevent the app from being reset.\n\nThese notifications will reappear every day until a new API key is entered
Receive a notification 5 days before your API key expires
Change the API token that the addy.io app authenticates with. The instance cannot be changed
Your current API key (%1$s) will expire in %2$s
Your current API key (%1$s) has no expiration, visit %2$s/settings to revoke this key
The expiry date of your API key could not be determined, visit %1$s/settings to revoke this key
Hide personal information such as email addresses in shortcuts, widgets and notifications
Your current subscription has no expiration
The expiry date of your subscription could not be determined
Receive a notification 7 days before your subscription expires to remind you to renew your subscription.\n\nThese notifications will reappear every day until the subscription has been renewed
Receive a notification 7 days before your subscription expires
Extend or upgrade your subscription, switch to a card subscription or redeem voucher codes
You are using a self-hosted instance of addy.io, subscriptions do not apply to self-hosted instances
When searching for an alias, show suggestions for domains you own
This alias has no from name set. Tap here to add one
This domain has no from name set. Tap here to add one
This username has no from name set. Tap here to add one

The \'From Name\' is shown when you send an email from an alias or reply anonymously to a forwarded email. If left blank, then the email alias itself will be used as the \'From Name\' e.g. \"%1$s\".

The \'From Name\' that is used for an alias is determined by the following priority:
1. Alias \'From Name\'
2. Username or Custom Domain \'From Name\'
3. Global \'From Name\' from the settings page

If you set the \'From Name\' for this specific alias, it will override the other settings.

The \'From Name\' is shown when you send an email from an alias or reply anonymously to a forwarded email. If left blank, then the email alias itself will be used as the \'From Name\' e.g. \"example@%1$s\".

The \'From Name\' that is used for an alias is determined by the following priority:
1. Alias \'From Name\'
2. Username or Custom Domain \'From Name\'
3. Global \'From Name\' from the settings page

If you set the \'From Name\' for this domain, it will override the global \'From Name\' setting.

The \'From Name\' is shown when you send an email from an alias or reply anonymously to a forwarded email. If left blank, then the email alias itself will be used as the \'From Name\' e.g. \"example@%1$s.addy.io\".

The \'From Name\' that is used for an alias is determined by the following priority:
1. Alias \'From Name\'
2. Username or Custom Domain \'From Name\'
3. Global \'From Name\' from the settings page

If you set the \'From Name\' for this username, it will override the global \'From Name\' setting.
Something went wrong while editing the from name
This feature is not available with your current subscription
%1$s has been forgotten and removed from the alias watcher
Do you want to apply this filter to the aliases list? This would clear your current filter
Change the interval at which data is updated in the background for widgets, for example
Tap here to manually check for new updates
Toggle this option to determine whether this username can be used to login to your account or not. When set to off you will not be able to use this username to login to your account
